caption:
Figure 2-1: Oxidation of methane to formaldehyde (Hanson and Hanson, 1996). MDH is 
methanol dehydrogynase, MMO is methane monooxygenase (s: soluble, p: particulate). 
CytC is cytochrome (red â€“reduced, ox -oxidized).
image_path: data/images/Copy of Adegbola thesis High Density Cultures/page16_fig1.png

caption:
Figure 2-2: Serine pathway for the assimilation of formaldehyde in Type II methanotrophs 
(Hanson and Hanson, 1996). Reactions catalyzed by enzymes unique to Type II 
menthanotrophs are: Serine hydroxymethyl transferase (STHM), hydroxypyruvate 
reductase (HPR), malate thiokinase (MTK), and malyl coenzyme A lyase (MCL).
image_path: data/images/Copy of Adegbola thesis High Density Cultures/page16_fig2.png
